Reviews.Title: “Horrible stay”
Reviews.Author: mothervivian4
Reviews.Content: No parking, no pool, no shampoo, no rinse, 2 towels in a room that fits 4, no microwave, fridge has so much ice in it that nothing fits, dirty dirty dirty, bathroom is dirty falling apart, this hotels needs to be shut down it is unsanitary oh and they charge you 100.00 deposit in case you damage something, really not much that isn't damaged already can be damaged, this is a waste of money, I was afraid to turn off the lights bugs bugs bugs, rooms stink really bad and on top of that they charge you 2.00 daily for a safe deposit box wether you use it or not, never again!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Thieves, Thieves, Thieves!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: skinflick123
Reviews.Content: If I could give a negative star I would. This place was the worst hotel experience I have had in my life. The sheets were dirty, the carpet was in worse shape I didn't want to walk barefoot in the room for fear of getting fungus, but worst of all is the fact that I left some very important items in the room that were stolen. If you value your possessions don't stay here!!!

Reviews.Title: “for the low maintenance traveler...”
Reviews.Author: Donjuan8880
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel many times over the past 6 years. It is extremely cheap (at times being as low as $29 per night) and the location is awesome. It is by no means a fancy place, as it is older and far outdated, but it does the trick if you just need somewhere to sleep for a low price. My room had two queen sized beds, a kitchenette and a bathroom. The room was clean, but once again, it is older, so the furniture and appliances were old. The people who work the desk are friendly and accommodating. The location is the best part because it is located in a little hidden terrace off of the main street, and the beach there is fairly unoccupied.

Reviews.Title: “not bad for one night stay”
Reviews.Author: takeme2Coz
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend had to make a business trip to Miami. We arrived late and just needed a place for one night before heading over to the gulf coast for our vacation. The hotel is old, but we found it clean. Very bare bones,hard beds and small rooms but ok for one night since we were checking out the next morning. No coffee pot or restaraunt. There is a Days Inn next door with a nice bar and good food. This hotel is right across from the beautiful beach. Cheap price and good location.

Reviews.Title: “OGM dont stay there....”
Reviews.Author: lolakTexass
Reviews.Content: This was absolutely the worst hotel I have ever been in !! The sign out front says "Open 24 Hrs" - wonder what that means... the smell of the mold and mildew competed with the smell of disinfectant to see which was strongest - had to turn off the A/C because of the dust and mold on the filter. The floors and fixtures were dusty - must not have been cleaned since the last review... we were booked by hotelscorp and they refused to move us but did cancel the deal - they wanted me to buy a timeshare and they put me in this dump ?... the night shift said they were all booked and could not change rooms . Unfortunate about this hotel because it is a great location...

Reviews.Title: “Good choice on budget travel”
Reviews.Author: textfast
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights in the Ocean Terrace Hotel early February 2004 at a price of only 49 dollars a night for 2 people. We expected few, but got a lot. Nice, spacy and clean rooms with kitchen and freezer. Friendly staff, beautiful beach just across the (quiet) street. Many (Spanish) restaurants nearby. Far from the noice of South Beach and Art Deco District, to be reached by bus easily. We can surely recommend this hotel to anyone who travels budget.

HotelInfo.Name: Ocean Terrace Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 7410 Ocean Terrace, Miami, FL 33141
